thread.title: Adrian College football falls to Olivet College
thread.title_full: Adrian College football falls to Olivet College

author: Daily Telegram staff
title: Adrian College football falls to Olivet College
text: Adrian College football falls to Olivet College Comment The Daily Telegram - Adrian, MI By Daily Telegram staff Posted Oct. 4, 2015 at 2:30 PM By Daily Telegram staff Posted Oct. 4, 2015 at 2:30 PM OLIVET Despite a closely contested first three quarters, the Adrian College football team fell to Michigan Intercollegiate Athletic Association opponennt Olivet 35-7 on Saturday, falling to 2-2, (0-1 MIAA) on the season. The Comets broke the game open with 21 points in the fourth quarter to take down the Bulldogs, improving to 4-0, 1-0 MIAA). Both teams were held scoreless in the first half, and Adrian started the scoring in the second half when Stephen Milarch found the end zone on a one-yard run with 11:10 remaining in the third quarter. The nine-play, 68-yard drive proved to be the best of the afternoon for the Bulldogs. On Olivetâ€™s next possession, it immediately answered when quarterback Braden Black found Jason Barbosa on a 72-yard touchdown pass, just 21 seconds after Adrian scored. The Comets scored four more times, racking up 35 unanswered points in the second half. Adrian quarterback Milarch led the team with 61 yards on the ground and added 178 yards through the air on 14 of 27 passing. Emanuel Steward chipped in with 53 yards on 13 carries, and caught five passes for 54 yards. Joey Kosielski caught two balls for 59 yards. Black racked up 300 yards passing on 21 of 30 passing to lead the Olivet offense. Chris Jones ran for 82 yards on 17 carries and Andre Houston ran for four touchdowns. Barbosa led the receiving corps with 112 yards and caught five passes. Olivet totalled 534 yards of offense, with 234 coming on the ground. It claimed the time of possession battle, handling the ball for 33:32 in the contest. Adrian will host Alma College next Saturday at Docking Stadium, a kickoff time of 5 p.m. By Daily Telegram staff The Daily Telegram - Adrian, MI By Daily Telegram staff
